episodes.title: The man behind the Watchtower organization
episodes.description:
I'm not joking it really is a crazy ride.  It's amazing to me how alike the beginning of the Mormon religion and Jehovah's Witnesses are with how they got their start.  One guy could read rocks in a special bucket with something covering his head.  (It really is a great story let me tell you!!  I might have to do a video)  The other guy went around spouting everyone needed to repent because Armageddon was happening anytime and everyone was going to be taken to heaven.  He just couldn't make up his mind when.  

Russell  worked as a partner with his dad selling mens clothing.  Sold it for a ton of money.   Got all these crazy guys spouting their teachings of that time together, and turned them into his own interpretation.   Then got two friends to put his predictions in their magazines and newspaper.  Nada.  Nothing happened.  But that wasn't going to stop young Charles T Russell who was determined - I prefer to say arrogant - to come up with his own explanations of what HE believed and his interpretations.  It didn't matter if they were true or not.  So he started a magazine to spout them.

The Mormon religion started with a poor farm boy in upstate New York.  He was determined to take his personal writings that were written under extremely questionable means and preach them to everyone as absolute fact and truth. 

The other a rich clothing store kid.  A guy who knew just enough to be dangerous when it came to the Bible.   He couldn't read Greek.  He couldn't read Hebrew.  The only thing he was really good at was copying someone else's interpretations and saying he came up with them himself.  That's who started what eventually became known as the Watchtower Bible and Tract Society.  Jehovah's Witnesses.   Crazy I tell ya!!  Hope you enjoy it

I was born and raised as one of Jehovah's Witnesses.  My parents met while serving under Nathan Knorr in the late 50's through the mid 60's.   They knew four of the seven people that were in prison with Rutherford in 1918.  But the history they were told had been whitewashed.  That's the history I grew up listening to.  Maybe that's the reason I'm so fascinated in the real history of the organization and Jehovah's Witnesses.   Because it's so different from the organizations white washed version.

episodes.title: Unquestioned power and authority.  History of the “Governing Body"
episodes.description:
Jehovah's Witnesses history of the evolving "Governing body" and how they came to have the complete authority they have now.  

It’s very important to remember the Watchtower Bible and Tract Society is a Corporate Business entity.  At one time the Governing Body were only administrators of this corporate entity until they separated themselves from legal corporate matters in 2001.  Over the last one hundred years their control over all Witnesses lives have got them the authority they now have.

My interpretation of the “Governing Body” through my research is that Joseph Rutherford wanted power and got it when he did his coup of Watchtower in 1917/18.  

After Rutherford’s death Fred Franz and Nathan Knorr started to turn the organization into the direction they wanted it to go.  This was after they told Hayden Covington he couldn’t be President because he wasn’t anointed.  Once Nathan Knorr became President he and Fred Franz started making all of these doctrinal changes and basically did whatever they wanted. The rest of the board stepped in and voted for more than one man to be in charge of the organization. What Charles Russell had originally intended but Rutherford just ignored.  That is why there is more than one man now as the "Faithful Slave".

I think Knorr was a great administrator and that is how he grew the organization to the extent he did.  Franz was this crazy bible thumper that had all these ideas he wanted put as “truths of the bible”.  These two men ran everything and my personal opinion is the rest of the board wanted to reign them in and that's how we got the arrangement we have today.

They turned a Publishing corporation into a worldwide religion

Now all men on the Governing Body - that was once made up of only board members - became supreme authority over all of Jehovah's Witnesses today.  As Russell, Rutherford and Knorr once were in their day.

A group of men who by their own admissions state they are imperfect, fallible and not inspired, so not spirit directed.  Yet they speak on behalf of Jesus.  I'm not sure how that works.

Just men with their own interpretations of the Bible just like Charles Russell, Joseph Rutherford, Nathan Knorr and all the men had who have followed.  

Now instead of a Publishing company the organization is a Real Estate holding, video production company promoting their website

It’s not new light when something is changed.  It’s just other mens interpretations of what their predecessors stated as truth.  See "Beliefs Clarified" on jw.org and on https://jws-library.one

Thanks for watching and Take care

Extra special thanks to editor_Mach
